metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at the top and bottom of the page, with the central image depicting three figures playing musical instruments, while others appear to be dancing. On the right, children and adults look on at them. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. An illustrated volume of Sa'di's Kulliyat, the miniatures from this manuscript appear to depict scenes from within the text and are rich in both colour and detail. Sources: Arnold, E. (2007) tr., Sa'di: The Gulistan, New York. Hukk, M (1925), A descriptive catalogue of the Arabic and Persian manuscripts in Edinburgh University Library, Hertford.
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Detail of image depicting scene from the Gulistan by the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Dated to 1258CE, the work, which is part prose and part poetry, discusses leadership, materialism and the virtues of silence. This illustration is taken from Sa'di's collected works (Kulliyat), which were first collated during the fourteenth century. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. An illustrated volume of Sa'di's Kulliyat, the miniatures from this manuscript appear to depict scenes from within the text and are rich in both colour and detail. Sources: Arnold, E. (2007) tr., Sa'di: The Gulistan, New York. Hukk, M (1925), A descriptive catalogue of the Arabic and Persian manuscripts in Edinburgh University Library, Hertford. http://classics.mit.edu/Sadi/gulistan.html (accessed 05/06/14).
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at top and bottom of the page, with central image possibly depicting a hunting scene: twelve figures are portrayed, of which three are mounted, while a number of others appear to be carrying weapons. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text in the top right quadrant, with a scene portraying various activities surrounding it. For example, in the tent on the left, the two figures appear to be playing a board game, while another individual can be seen cooking below. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at top and bottom of the page, with central image depicting four individuals on horseback, along with another two figures on foot. The deer hiding behind a rock at the left of the image indicates that this may be a hunting scene. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at top and bottom of the page, with central image depicting a hunting scene. From left to right, image shows: figure carrying a deer on his shoulders; two individuals talking; individual on horseback shooting a deer with an arrow; figure killing deer with sword; individual on horseback killing lion with sword; mounted figure reaching for an arrow from his quiver. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. An illustrated volume of Sa'di's Kulliyat, the miniatures from this manuscript appear to depict scenes from within the text and are rich in both colour and detail. Sources: Arnold, E. (2007) tr., Sa'di: The Gulistan, New York. Hukk, M (1925), A descriptive catalogue of the Arabic and Persian manuscripts in Edinburgh University Library, Hertford.

metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian Poet Sa'di. Shows text at the top and bottom of the page, with the central image depicting a battle scene. All figures in the image are dressed in armour and many can be seen carrying weapons. Towards the bottom of the image, a severed head can be seen lying on the ground, red paint indicating blood pouring from the neck. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. An illustrated volume of Sa'di's Kulliyat, the miniatures from this manuscript appear to depict scenes from within the text and are rich in both colour and detail. Sources: Arnold, E. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text in the top left quadrant, with the image surrounding it. Depicts two figures on horseback in the foreground, along with a number of others on foot. Three tents can be seen behind, the first being lavishly decorated in red with gold floral motifs and with a woman standing at the entrance. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at the top and bottom of the page, with the central image depicting a figure reclining on a couch, and another sleeping. The other individuals in the image have their hands reaching towards the reclining figure, possibly paying homage to him. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kulliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text in the top left quadrant, with an image surrounding it. metadata.value: Detail of page from the Kuliyat (Collected Works) of the popular Persian poet Sa'di. Shows text at the top and bottom of the page, with the central image depicting three figures playing musical instruments, while others appear to be dancing. On the right, children and adults look on at them. Image possibly represents a Sama Scene with Dervishes dancing in ecstasy. Read widely throughout the world and influencing the writings of individuals such as Diderot, Hugo and Voltaire, the works of Sa'di (d.1291), were first collected into a single volume during the fourteenth century and are known for their social and moral themes. An illustrated volume of Sa'di's Kulliyat, the miniatures from this manuscript appear to depict scenes from within the text and are rich in both colour and detail. Sources: Arnold, E.
